Names of participants: (Please print neatly)

 
 
 
School Name:

Note: There are useful notes after this page.

CIPHER.25.cipherString: Everything about microscopic life is terribly upsetting. How can things so small be so important?
CIPHER.25.question: The following quote by Isaac Asimov has been encoded as an Aristocrat.  What did he say?

CIPHER.39.cipherString: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor
CIPHER.39.question: A quote by Truman Capote has been encoded as a Fractionated Morse Cipher.  You are told that it ends with LAVOR.  What did they say?

CIPHER.31.cipherString: I rode an elevator with a guy who was whistling the tune of 'this is the song that never ends'. Putting that on me? Come on dude..
CIPHER.31.question: A quote by Taylor Swift has been encoded as a Patristocrat using a K2 keyword.  What did she say?

CIPHER.41.cipherString: The difference between fiction and reality? Fiction has to make sense.
CIPHER.41.question: The following quote by Tom Clancy has been encoded as a Porta Cipher using a key of BOOK.  What did they say?

CIPHER.33.cipherString: If you're looking at the watch while working, better take rest.
CIPHER.33.question: The following symbols are a Baconian Cipher of some advice by Rajesh Walecha.  What did they say?

CIPHER.43.question: Decoding the following Cryptarithm should allow you to decode the the phrase 31814595 81852 7146524.  What does it decode to?

CIPHER.27.cipherString: It is hard to understand how a cemetery raised its burial cost and blamed it on the cost of living.
CIPHER.27.question: An interesting observation has been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K1 alphabet.  What was said?

CIPHER.38.cipherString: Some people feel the rain. Others just get wet.
CIPHER.38.question: A quote has been encoded using the Morbit Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 9=×●, 8=–×, 7=●×, 6=●–, 5=–●

CIPHER.46.cipherString: Reality provides us with facts so romantic that imagination itself could add nothing to them.
CIPHER.46.question: A quote by Jules Verne has been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K1 key phrase.  What was the phrase used to encode the quote?

CIPHER.47.cipherString: What matters is not the facts but how you discover and think about them.
CIPHER.47.question: The following quote by Richard Dawkins has been encoded as a Railfence using 4 rails.  What does it decode to?

CIPHER.28.cipherString: On an occasion of this kind it becomes more than a moral duty to speak one's mind. It becomes a pleasure.
CIPHER.28.question: A quote by Oscar Wilde has been encode as an Aristocrat using a K2 keyword.  What did they say?

CIPHER.32.cipherString: Ah, but I was so much older then Im younger than that now
CIPHER.32.question: The following quote by Bob Dylan has been encoded as a Baconian cipher.  What did he say?

CIPHER.40.cipherString: I think there is a song out there to describe just about any situation.
CIPHER.40.question: The following quote by Criss Jami has been encoded as a Porta cipher with a keyword of DICE.  What does it decode to?

CIPHER.26.cipherString: The mirrors of capitalism will never reflect us as wealthy, successful or even worthy. - Change perception
CIPHER.26.question: the following Aristocrat is a quote by Malebo Sephodi.  What did they say?

CIPHER.42.question: Solve the following Cryptarithm to get the key to decode 20134 70169.

CIPHER.49.question: Decode the following statement by Marshall McLuhan which has been encoded as a Hill cipher using a keyword of POET.

CIPHER.30.cipherString: A dream is a seed. Vision plants it. Imagination nurtures growth. Opportunities create blooms. Thoughts become things!
CIPHER.30.question: Donna McGoff offers us some observations encoded as a Patristocrat using a K1 alphabet.  What did they say?

CIPHER.34.cipherString: He will be looked upon by posterity as a brave bad man.
CIPHER.34.question: The following odd sentences are a Baconian encoding of a statement by the Earl of Clarendon that starts with HEWIL.  What did he say?

CIPHER.44.cipherString: Life is not like water. Things in life don't necessarily flow over the shortest possible route.
CIPHER.44.question: The following quote by Haruki Murakami was encoded as an Aristocrat using a K3 alphabet using a Key Phrase.  What was the Key Phrase used to encode it?

CIPHER.29.cipherString: Whee our the cosmos made conchus and lief is teh measn by witch the uinverse undertsands istelf.
CIPHER.29.question: Your friend who can't spell or type very well is trying to offer you some advice which has then been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K1 alphabet.  What did they actually type in?

CIPHER.36.cipherString: I am learning, and I believe I shall do quite well.
CIPHER.36.question: A quote by Shannon Drake has been encoded using the Pollux Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 1=–, 2=●, 3=×, 4=–, 5=●

CIPHER.45.cipherString: The desire to take medicine is perhaps the greatest feature which distinguishes man from animals.
CIPHER.45.question: An observation by Sir William Osler has been encoded as an Aristocrat using a K1 keyword.  What was the keyword used to encode it?

CIPHER.35.cipherString: Todas las ciencias son vanas y llenas de errores que no nacen de la Experiencia, madre de todo Saber.
CIPHER.35.question: A quote by Leonardo da Vinci has been translated into Spanish and encoded as an Aristocrat using an English K1 keyword.
CIPHER.35.translation: All sciences are vain and full of errors that are not born of Experience, the mother of all Knowledge.

CIPHER.37.cipherString: Show me a hero and I will write you a tragedy.
CIPHER.37.question: A quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald has been encoded using the Morbit Cipher for you to decode. You are told that 1=×–, 2=●–, 3=–×, 4=×●, 5=●●

CIPHER.48.question: Encode the following phrase as a Hill cipher using a keyword of FIND
